snippet: After an incident between fans and Barclays Center security guards during Tuesday’s 5-1 loss to the Florida Panthers, arena officials said alcohol sales would be cut off after the second period of Islanders games.
abstract: Barclays Center will end alcohol sales after second period of New York Islanders games, and limit purchases to two drinks, after incident involving fans and area security personnel; other pro hockey news noted.
lead_paragraph: After an incident between fans and Barclays Center security guards during Tuesday’s 5-1 loss to the Florida Panthers, arena officials said alcohol sales would be cut off after the second period of Islanders games.
